metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8366 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Array index error in smal_decode_segment function in LibRaw before 0.17.1 allows context-dependent attackers to cause memory errors and possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to indexes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dcraw - 9.28-2
No subscription required

libraw-bin - 0.18.2-1
libraw19 - 0.18.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: darktable package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
dcraw package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.28-2').
exactimage package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
kodi package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
libraw package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.2-1').
rawtherapee package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
